issue.title: Two small glitches in generated code with version 2.5.918

repository.name: EFCorePowerTools
repository.description: Entity Framework Core Power Tools - reverse engineering, migrations and model visualization in Visual Studio & CLI

issue.body:
Hello, 
With version 2.5.918 and with the advanced option "use nullable reference types", against .Net 6 / EF 6, I noticed two weirds things :

--- First issue :

1.  I have a table with a column 
`IsEnabled BIT NOT NULL DEFAULT(1)`
It generates the following code :
`public bool? IsEnabled { get; set; }`
Maybe it's intended (to force user to assign manually a value to the field), but I was expecting a non-nullable bool.

--- Second issue :

2. I have two tables as this :
```
CREATE TABLE [ppm].[A]
	(
	Id INT IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
           IdB INT NOT NULL,
CONSTRAINT FK_A_B FOREIGN KEY (IdB)
    REFERENCES [ppm].[B](Id))

CREATE TABLE [ppm].[B]
	(
	Id INT IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
...);
```

So A points to B.
In "B" generated class, I get this navigation property :
`public virtual A A { get; set; } = null!;`
Where I was expecting
`public virtual A? A { get; set; }`
because there is no guarantee that a A record always exists for a B record (even if the FK is not nullable in A, the A record itself may not exist), so it could perfectly be null.

I have seen the Nullable feature is still experimental, and it does not prevent anything to work, I'm just sharing just in case it could help to improve it further.

Thank you !

issue.title: Fix scaffolding of reference navigations with NRT

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

body: Yeah, I think it makes sense - will bring to the team for discussion.
@roji Did this go into a 6.0 patch? If so, which one?
Whoops, looks like this slipped under the radar - we didn't service this. I'll prepare a PR.

issue.title: Fix scaffolding of reference navigations with NRT (#27616)

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #27496

(cherry picked from commit ec9c6c235a5a04fcc48520c4585a375b2778600d)

**Description**

When scaffolding an existing database in a project with nullable reference types enabled, dependent navigations are incorrectly scaffolded as non-nullable.

**Customer impact**

An incorrect model is scaffolded and must be manually fixed up.

**How found**

Customer reported on 6.0

**Regression**

No, scaffolding NRT code was introduced in 6.0 (#15520)

**Testing**

Added.

**Risk**

Low - affects design-time scaffolding only.
